channel.title: Dedicated server map problems
channel.description:
Hey,
Since, a couple of days I've been having an issue with the dedicated server.
Several maps seem to differ between the dedicated server and the main game.
When i load the maps through the menu play online and start the maps, they load perfectly.
But when I try to play the maps through the dedicated server he gives me the message, that they differ from the server.
I've been running a vanilla game and a vanilla server. So it shouldn't be a workshop / mod related problem.
I also tried to verify the gamecaches of both the game and the server, but the issue persists.
here is a picture of the message,
[spoiler][img]https://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/263840737163613137/EA98B78C8D8390F6874C96E7A998D5A51385972D/[/img][/spoiler]
Is this a known problem and/or is there a way to resolve this issue?
Kind regards,
Doragon

item.title: Dedicated server map problems
item.dc:creator: Flavrans
item.description:
Not having the dedicated server installed, I can’t confirm this, but according to https://steamdb.info/app/346680/depots/, the current build of the Black Mesa Dedicated Server was released on May 14, 2016 – 22:19:04 UTC. That was the same day the Black Mesa v0.3.0 Content Update was released. However, the v0.3.1 patch to Black Mesa was released on June 5, 2016 – 05:53:03 UTC, and it doesn’t look like they updated the Dedicated Server along with the regular game. So that might explain why the local and server maps differ.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated server map problems
item.dc:creator: Doragon
item.description:
Hey,

Since, a couple of days I’ve been having an issue with the dedicated server.

Several maps seem to differ between the dedicated server and the main game.

When i load the maps through the menu play online and start the maps, they load perfectly.

But when I try to play the maps through the dedicated server he gives me the message, that they differ from the server.

I’ve been running a vanilla game and a vanilla server. So it shouldn’t be a workshop / mod related problem.

I also tried to verify the gamecaches of both the game and the server, but the issue persists.

here is a picture of the message,

1920×1080

Is this a known problem and/or is there a way to resolve this issue?

Kind regards,
